com.camerontec.catalys.core.session.scp

Class ScpOutboundContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.core.session.scp.ScpOutboundContext

  • public class ScpOutboundContext
extends Object
    Used by FIX sessions to transform outgoing SCP messages into FAST encoded bytes. These bytes are then sent on the session's out 'channel'. Outbound SCP message are of type ScpOutboundMessage which extends OrderedFIXMessage

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ScpOutboundContext(boolean clearPolicyValue, boolean blockedFormat, int overlongBlocksizeLength, boolean printMessages)
      Constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScpOutboundContext

        public ScpOutboundContext(boolean clearPolicyValue,
                          boolean blockedFormat,
                          int overlongBlocksizeLength,
                          boolean printMessages)
                   throws Exception
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        clearPolicyValue - Will be used while creating FastOutputStream for SCP.
        blockedFormat - True if this stream uses blocks - see FAST spec in section on Transfer Encoding: "A FAST stream consists of a sequence of messages or a sequence of blocks." See FastOutputStream.flushBuffer() for how message blocks are defined. Will be used while creating FastOutputStream for SCP.
        overlongBlocksizeLength - The length of the overlong integer after encoding (in bytes). Will be taken in consideration only if blocked format is used. If 0 supplied the normal (not overlong) integer will be used as a block size. Will be used while creating FastOutputStream for SCP.
        printMessages - Whether to print messages sent over the FAST output stream
        Throws:
        Exception - TBD

    • Method Detail

      • createResetMessage

        public IFIXMessage createResetMessage()
        Send SCP.reset message on the given session It is not enough to synchronize access to this object during the the call to this method. The synchronization should remain until we send the message otherwise the template selector may return the wrong template id. see ScpSupportHandler.sendReset()
        Returns:
        SCP reset message

      • createHelloMessage

        public IFIXMessage createHelloMessage(String senderName,
                                      String vendorId)
        Create SCP.Hello message It is not enough to synchronize access to this object during the the call to this method. The synchronization should remain until we send the message otherwise the template selector may return the wrong template id. see ScpVersion11Level2Handler.sendHelloMessage()
        Parameters:
        senderName - sender name as per SCP specs.
        vendorId - vendor id as per SCP specs.
        Returns:
        SCP hello message

      • createAlertMessage

        public IFIXMessage createAlertMessage(int severity,
                                      int code,
                                      int value,
                                      String description)
        Send SCP.Alert message It is not enough to synchronize access to this object during the the call to this method. The synchronization should remain until we send the message otherwise the template selector may return the wrong template id. see ScpVersion11Level2Handler.sendAlert(int, int, int, java.lang.String)
        Parameters:
        severity - Severity of the alert
        code - Code of the alert
        value - Depends on code. If -1 then no value is sent
        description - Description of the alert. If null then no description is sent
        Returns:
        SCP alert message

      • getSendingTransformer

        public FastSendingTransformer getSendingTransformer()
        Returns:
        the FAST sending transformer associated with the SCP templates
